channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car abandoned, 13th August
item.description:
Taking up the minimal space available on our road and it’s been here for months and building up mess and dirt

item.title: Fly tipping at junction of Wellington Mews and Wellington Gardens, 13th August
item.description:
Large sofa dumped las week has now been joined by assorted boxes, furnishings etc. Everything is spilling over the public footpath. This is a hotspot for fly tipping. Please can we have clearance and some cameras which might identify who does this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Gardens, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Sainsbury's shopping trolley, 13th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torr Road, Penge, London

item.title: Residents leaving rubbish on the street, 13th August
item.description:
There are bags and boxes of household rubbish partly blocking the pavement here on Parish Lane. This has become quite a regular occurrence in this location, despite there being a walled front garden to store refuse in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge sunk ,kerb sunk , hole goes beneath a satellite box, 13th August
item.description:
This defect is dangerous and not easily seen as it disappears under the satellite box , it is on the south verge in Rowley avenue alongside the garden of 118 burnt oak lane. The hole is deceptively deep.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Rowley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pram ,bowl & radiator dumped in Woodstock Crescent N9, 13th August
item.description:
A pram ,bowl & a radiator has been dumped in Woodstock Crescent N9. Looks like same person dumping recently as in the same place each time near the parking restrictions pole.! These people need to be stopped from constantly blighting our streets. Fines & camera needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodstock Crescent, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over Craig’s Court, 13th August
item.description:
Please remove some bins - all businesses dumping theurwaste should have their licence reviewed. who supervises Street cleaners - please move their bin as they never clean Craig's court - just use is as their dumping ground please make businesses - pubs - to safely dispose of food - issues with vermin in the residential building - yet they ( especially Walkers of Whitehall ) never clean but serve their customers on the public property - pavement and the road next to feces urine etc - why is this tolerated for so long ? the alleyway is too narrow to have all these people blocking it 24 /7 everyone dumping their waste and nobody cleaning it - pubs are making a fortune at the expense of hygienic environment - please start putting some measures in !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
